outline:
1. to rise, rise up, be high, be lofty, be exalted
    1. (Qal)
      1. to be high, be set on high
      2. to be raised, be uplifted, be exalted
      3. to be lifted, rise
    2. (Polel)
      1. to raise or rear (children), cause to grow up
      2. to lift up, raise, exalt
      3. to exalt, extol
    3. (Polal) to be lifted up
    4. (Hiphil)
      1. to raise, lift, lift up, take up, set up, erect, exalt, set on high
      2. to lift up (and take away), remove
      3. to lift off and present, contribute, offer, contribute
    5. (Hophal) to be taken off, be abolished
    6. (Hithpolel) to exalt oneself, magnify oneself
  2. (Qal) to be rotten, be wormy
kjv_def: bring up, exalt (self), extol, give, go up, haughty, heave (up), (be, lift up on, make on, set up on, too) high(-er, one), hold up, levy, lift(-er) up, (be) lofty, ([idiom] a-) loud, mount up, offer (up), [phrase] presumptuously, (be) promote(-ion), proud, set up, tall(-er), take (away, off, up), breed worms.
strongs_def: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
